column1: Rocky River is a city in western Cuyahoga County
column2: Ohio
column3: United States.  A suburb of Cleveland
column4: it is located along the shore of Lake Erie approximately 9 miles (14 km) west of downtown Cleveland.  The city is named for the Rocky River that forms its eastern border. The population was 20
column5: 213 at the time of the 2010 census.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 5.61 square miles (14.53 km2)
column3: of which 4.74 square miles (12.28 km2) is land and 0.87 square miles (2.25 km2) is water.Most of Rocky River's eastern border follows the river bearing its name
column4: which runs through the Rocky River Reservation of the Cleveland Metroparks system
column5: adjacent to the city's eastern neighbor
column6: Lakewood. A small strip of Cleveland itself also borders Rocky River; however
column7: the two cities are not directly connected via road. Lake Erie lines the entire northern border of the city while the city of Fairview Park marks the southern border. On Rocky River's western border are the cities of Bay Village to the northwest and Westlake to the southwest.
